body: There are ~7 places in `App.tsx` where `this.sessionInfo.current` is accessed. Of those locations, only `handlePageProfileMsg` and `requestFileURLs` do NOT guard the access with a `this.sessionInfo.isSet` condition. Lazy initialization sounds like an easy fix but I'd be a bit cautious about unintended consequences. On the other hand, adding the `isSet` guard to these two `App` functions seems like an easy way to avoid the error.

issue.title: Keep SessionInfo active after initialization, but include connection information

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

We hit race conditions where the session info is cleared (on disconnect) and reconnected before a page profile message is sent. We've hit multiple issues with this, so the safest option is to not completely delete the sessionInfo. In the event of the page profile, the message is sent with the latest information it knows. We save the connection state in the session info and update it to be disconnected on disconnect. It will reset once a new NewSession message arrives.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)
closes #9767

## Testing Plan

- Unit tests are updated

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

body:
Hey @bfbachmann ! Thanks for reaching out and filing the issue. This certainly has been a thorn, and we ought to re-assess the best way to handle this. In the meantime, I added the checks for extra simplicity (Thanks @Asaurus1 for highlighting the locations). You can try this out in the PR wheel file here https://core-previews.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/pr-9886/streamlit-1.40.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl. I would love to know this works for your use case.

```
pip install streamlit-1.40.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
```

@kmcgrady - The PR wheel that you provided did not seem to resolve my issue. I am experiencing this same error intermittently when trying to upload files using the file_uploader, however I receive the error in the console not the UI. 

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/78d5a650-f1a5-4327-9a63-d04b04cabeec)

The behavior is that when I go to upload a file, I will always get the windows explorer page to select the file but it will not always successfully upload. It seems that if the page was recently refreshed, I am able to upload just fine but if I wait for a period of time then I will receive the above error. 

After installing the PR wheel that you provided, I am having the same behavior but no error message in the console is logged.

Hey @rnegronida, thanks for giving it a test. I think the change here is tied to [this change](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/9083). When a reconnect happens (which is bound to happen), we do not reset the "SessionInfo" which causes this issue. In the past, any reconnect triggered a full rerun, which would ensure the SessionInfo got set correctly. The change only will rerun if it's the first time, or the script was running on disconnect. It was designed to avoid the need to rerun if everything is back, which in theory is a better experience.

The two solutions here are:
1. Revert the change and force the rerun on any re-connect.
2. Simply reset the SessionInfo to the previous one.
    a. Similarly, we could just not clear the session info on disconnect and just update it as we get new information.

I'd love for (2) to work, but I would be nervous for a scenario where the upload went to a different session, and essentially it gets lost in the mix. Will have to think more on this.
@kmcgrady - Thank you for the insight! I have reverted to 1.37.0 and things seem to functioning as expected.

I'm facing the same issue in multiple apps, but it's very hard to reproduce. Every now and then it happens, and it's hard to pin why.

```js
index.Phesr84n.js:99 
Error: Tried to use SessionInfo before it was initialized
    at get current (index.Phesr84n.js:724:51316)
    at App.handlePageProfileMsg (index.Phesr84n.js:798:31560)
    at Object.pageProfile (index.Phesr84n.js:798:29347)
    at ot (index.Phesr84n.js:798:28763)
    at App.handleMessage [as onMessage] (index.Phesr84n.js:798:28825)
    at WebsocketConnection.handleMessage (index.Phesr84n.js:798:3075)
```

In my experience, this sessionInfo error happens when the browser tab has been idle for a while. 
We tried reverting to version 1.37.0, which does not pose the error, but instead just refreshes the page and the whole conversation is gone (also when returning to the idle tab after a while).
@kmcgrady curious if any progress has been made on this? running into the same issue on `1.42.0`

> [@kmcgrady](https://github.com/kmcgrady) curious if any progress has been made on this? running into the same issue on `1.42.0`

@arcticmatt are you seeing the issue in conjunction with leaving the browser tab idle as mentioned by Laura above?
